Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律か……
Entry.EnglishText: Right, the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... She can't talk to me because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that she can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律……ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh...the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right, those commmandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: He isn't allowed to talk to women because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司様が、若い男手が要るって 街の有志を募ってたなあ……
Entry.EnglishText: The priest is asking for volunteers amongst the younger men of this town...

Entry.JapaneseText: 力仕事か、何か知らんが、 ワシには無理じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: I have no idea if he needs them for manpower or not, but unfortunately I can't help.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何を話していたかはわからないけどねえ…… でも、祭司様はよく海を眺めていたねえ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't remember what he said, but apparently the priest was gazing out at the sea.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、ヒューマどもが何かと ワシらガジュマにケチをつけて ケンカをふっかけて来る……
Entry.EnglishText: Recently Huma have been picking fights with us Gajuma over petty matters...

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、蒼の聖殿にも行かず、 ここでお祈りをする毎日だよ……
Entry.EnglishText: That's why I've been heading to the sanctuary to pray lately...

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえたちヒューマのせいで、 最近は出歩く事もままならん…… 蒼獣様への参拝もできん！
Entry.EnglishText: Because of you Huma, I couldn't take even one step outside... Much less go to the sanctuary!

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣様がお怒りになって、 ワシにバチが当たったら…… ワシはヒューマを許さんぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: I won't forgive Huma... Even if the Azure Beast punishes me in anger, I wont!

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシらガジュマにも、 悪いところはあったかも しれんな……
Entry.EnglishText: I suppose we Gajuma have made our own share of mistakes...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたらのお陰で 少しはこの街の風通しが よくなったぞい。
Entry.EnglishText: The town has become more open now thanks to you guys.

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣聖典を改めて読み直す事にしたよ。 現代語版ではなく、原版をな。 教えを正しく理解するために……
Entry.EnglishText: I've been going through the original Scripture. This time, I want to properly learn and understand what it says...

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、この音が気になって 古代カレギア語の勉強が ちっとも進まん……
Entry.EnglishText: This sound has been bothering me, I can't focus on my Ancient Callegean studies...

Entry.JapaneseText: 世の中が大変な事になっとるが これは断じて、蒼獣様のお怒り ではない！
Entry.EnglishText: The world may have fallen into disarray, but I'm sure that this isn't because of the Azure Beast's anger.

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼獣様はきっとこの災いと 戦っておられる……！
Entry.EnglishText: For He must be fighting the calamity himself!

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシもお祈りを奉げる事で、 共に戦っとるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I will do my best and support him by praying here!

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司様は素晴らしいお方だ。 我らバビログラード民の誇りじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: The priest is a splendid person. Truly the pride of Babilograd!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『古代カレギア語・長文読解』 初歩的なカレギア語の学習書。 よく使い込まれている。 チェックや書き込みが多いが、 時々「むずかしすぎる！」といった グチのような書き込みも見られる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- An Extensive Look into Ancient Callegean - An elementary book for studying Callegean. It's worn out from use. Filled with comments and criticisms with the occasional "This is too hard!"

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『蒼獣の祭壇』 熱心に蒼獣を信仰している家庭に しばしば見られる祭壇。 中央は蒼獣像、左右の水晶は 蒼獣の力の源とされる水を表す。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Azure Beast's Altar - An altar usually seen in devout family's homes. A figure of the Azure Beast with two crystals beside it which represent water, said to symbolize the Beast's source of power.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『蒼獣様、ご誕生』 蒼獣誕生の瞬間を描いたとされる絵。 抽象画なので、何がどうなのか いまひとつよくわからない作品。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- The Birth of the Azure Beast - A painting capturing the moment the Azure Beast was born. Since it's an abstract painting, you're not really sure what's going on.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『独身者用たんす』 ごく普通のたんす。お手ごろで丈夫だが、 インテリアとしては少々味気ない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0> - Chest of Drawers for Bachelors - An ordinary chest of drawers. Affordable and sturdy, yet tasteless as an interior decoration.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『たんすの中身』 服はあまり多くない。 しかも、同じ服が二着ずつある。 保守的な人柄がうかがえる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Drawer's Contents - There's not a lot of clothes inside. Additionally, two of the outfits are identical. The owner must be quite conservative.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『基礎の古代カレギア語文法』
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Foundation of Ancient Callegean Grammar -

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『基礎の古代カレギア語文法』 単語にはヒューマ名詞、ガジュマ名詞、 ハーフ名詞などの種族があります。 その単語の種族に応じて動詞の語尾が 二十六段活用します。また、形容詞は 種族に加えて性別があり……
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Foundation of Ancient Callegean Grammar - There are nouns such as "Huma," "Gajuma," and "Half" here. Verbs are conjugated in 26 different variations depending on the race using it. In addition, emphasis is placed on the gender when using adjectives...

Entry.JapaneseText: うむ……難解だな。 やはり言葉は若いうちに 学ぶべきだな……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... This is difficult. As I thought, language is supposed to be learned when you're young.

Entry.JapaneseText: これこれ…… 私も使ったわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh my... I remember using this.

Entry.JapaneseText: ナニコレー!? 読む気すらおきないんですけど！
Entry.EnglishText: What the!? I don't even want to try and read this!

Entry.JapaneseText: お、おれは現代カレギア人だ…… 古代カレギア語は、必要ない。 今を生きるぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: I-I'm a present day Callegean...! I don't need to learn Ancient Callegean! I live in the NOW!
